Context: The Pinball Clemons Foundation and RBC Future Launch have expanded their partnership with George Brown College to provide career pathways and mentorship for BIPOC (Black, Indigenous and People of Colour) youth in the Greater Toronto Area. The program is offered online through George Brown College and will have a cohort of 20 students aged 19 to 29. It consists of 15 weeks, with the first 2 weeks being intensive mentorship and the remaining 13 weeks being an academic micro-credential course. The partnership is funded by Pinball Clemons Foundation and RBC Future Launch, which is part of RBC's $500 million commitment to empowering Canadian youth for future jobs. The program aims to help remove barriers for BIPOC youth living on low income or who are unemployed/underemployed. At the end of the program, students will be connected with corporate partners for recruitment. In 2020, RBC committed to providing $50 million in focused funding through RBC Future Launch for creating meaningful and transformative pathways to prosperity for up to 25,000 BIPOC youth by 2025. Michael “Pinball” Clemons expressed his appreciation for the collaboration between these organizations.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Pinball Clemons Foundation Partners with RBC Future Launch and George Brown College to Enable Career Opportunities for BIPOC Youth | George Brown College.txt

Context: The text discusses a partnership between The Pinball Clemons Foundation and George Brown College to provide opportunities for young people, particularly those from underrepresented backgrounds (BIPOC youth). The program includes mentorship, academic classes, and 15-week paid internships with corporate partners such as Apple Express, Chartwells, Collective Arts, Longo’s, Moneris, and others. The students will gain access to the college's resources, including career centers, libraries, student services, and academic advising. The program aims to strengthen students' self-advocacy skills, literacy skills, and teach strategies for life-long learning. At the end of the program, graduates receive a certificate of completion from George Brown College. Interested youth can email info@pinballfoundation.ca for more information, while prospective corporate partners are invited to contact The Pinball Clemons Foundation for opportunities on offering internships or employment.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Pinball Clemons Foundation Partners with RBC Future Launch and George Brown College to Enable Career Opportunities for BIPOC Youth | George Brown College.txt
